data.title: Lucian Freud, colossus of art, dies aged 88
data.meta_description: Lucian Freud, one of the most celebrated and identifiable British artists of his generation, has died, his family said last night. He was 88.  The artist, whose intense style of portraiture attracted
data.text:
Lucian Freud, one of the most celebrated and identifiable British artists of his generation, has died, his family said last night. He was 88.

The artist, whose intense style of portraiture attracted sitters including the Queen and Kate Moss, died at home on Wednesday night after he became severely ill.

David Dawson, who acted as Freud’s assistant for 20 years, said that he was proud to have worked with such a great man. “He died peacefully at home,” he said. “He just gently slipped away. What a great man. What a great privilege. It was amazing to have that time with him. He was unique. It seems clichéd, but he was. I’m very sad at the moment.”

Friends said that he had become gravely ill
